content.question: A ball is dropped from the top of a very tall building and falls with negligible air resistance. The instantaneous power delivered to the ball by the force of gravity when the ball has a velocity of <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>. What is the power delivered to the ball when its velocity is <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
